column5: Jimmy Squarefoot is a Manx cryptid described as a hairy humanoid with a boar-like head, tusks, and an affinity for water. Legend says he once served a giant before roaming the Grenaby district, charging at travelers yet remaining oddly endearing in folklore.

column3: The Fairy Pig of the Sloc
column5: A young boy on the Isle of Man chases a strange white “fairy pig” up a mountain, only to escape just before it drives him over a steep edge. Stricken by a burning pain said to be a “fairy shot, ” he is healed by a Charmer’s ritual—and warned never again to wander the hills alone at dusk.

The Pig-Man of Cannock Chase is a long-rumored creature said to stalk the Staffordshire woodlands, with witnesses describing a towering, humanoid figure crowned by a grotesque pig-like head. For over 70 years, locals have linked the eerie sightings to wartime secrets and paranormal “portal” lore, making the Pig-Man one of England’s strangest modern legends.

The Northfield Pigman is a Vermont urban legend about Sam Harris, a teen who vanished in 1951 and was later rumored to haunt the woods wearing a hollowed-out pig’s head. Over the decades, locals have claimed sightings of a white-haired creature prowling farms and forest trails, blending small-town mystery with campfire horror.

A condemned criminal named Olocher killed himself on the eve of his execution, after which Dublin was terrorized by reports of a supernatural “black pig” attacking night sentries and women, a creature locals believed to be the vengeful spirit of the dead man. The panic ended when a blacksmith knocked the monster senseless, revealing it to be a disguised accomplice who had staged the hauntings to commit theft.

column3: The Pig Man of East Hull
column5: East Hull’s Pig Man is a modern urban legend describing a deformed, squealing figure seen rummaging through bins at night and haunting back gardens. Locals claim the creature favors pork-flavored snacks, fueling rumors of cannibalism and adding to the area’s catalogue of strange folklore.

The Shelby Forest Pig Man is a Tennessee legend about a factory worker horribly disfigured in a WWII-era explosion who became a shunned recluse, sparking rumors that his pig-like visage haunted bridges and forest roads. Over time, ghost stories, summoning rituals, and similar Pigman tales from other states blended into a broader urban-legend tradition meant to scare teens and explain strange noises in the woods.
A monstrous wild boar (or other cryptid) that supposedly terrorized the Forest of Dean, leading hunters on a futile chase.

Twrch Trwyth is a cursed prince in the form of a gigantic wild boar who rampages through Ireland, Wales, and beyond, bearing a magical comb, scissors, and razor between his ears. King Arthur and his knights hunted the creature relentlessly across sea and land, but although they seize the treasures, Arthur never succeeds in capturing the Twrch Trwyth as it jumped into the sea near Lands End.
